channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024040801
item.description:
Report X-2024040801

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During inspection it was noted that the four gallons were put inside a plastic bag and tied with a zip tie. The gallons were not actively leaking but there was a strong smell and the inside of the bag was damp. Two of the gallons looked like they had lost fluid. DescribePack: The box was wet. The inside of the bag was wet. I am unsure where the leak came from DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a plastic lined tote and put in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040831
item.description:
Report X-2024040831

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE HAZMAT WAS FOUND WITH THE BOTTOM SOAKED. THE ADMIN CAREFULLY PLACED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT IT TO THE HAZ CAGE FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: THE ITEM WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE IN A PLASTIC BAG FILLING WITH THE LIQUID FROM THE JUG. THE BOX HAD BUBBLE WRAP IN IT BUT DID NOT HELP SUPPORT THE ITEM FROM STAYING UPRIGHT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: EVERYTHING WAS PLACED INSIDE A LINED DRUM FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found leaking on dock PH test performed to verify that it was the Hazmat that was leaking. ph levels showed that the hazmat was leaking. package was placed in hazmat tote and brought to hazmat area DescribePack: marks approximately half way down box shows some wear possibly from another package or packing starps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in hazmat tote and brought to hazmat area

item.title: Report E-2024040312
item.description:
Report E-2024040312

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight observed one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident that punctured the container. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleanup the released material and overpacked the damaged drum into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum along with the cleanup debris.

item.title: Report X-2024040678
item.description:
Report X-2024040678

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: ROLLA
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024040678 SequenceEvent: When unloading the trailer the box was discovered to be wet due to leakage from within the box. DescribePack: the package does not appear to have any holes in it. It looks like the cap was not on securely. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the box was segregated from other boxes and placed into a hazmat tote. 2. X-2024040704 SequenceEvent: The package was sent up the belt and upon picking up the package the package handler discovered the box was leaking. The box was segregated from other packages and placed into a hazmat tote and taken to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: The top was not screwed on tightly DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: There was no spillage on the van line and the employee who got some on their skin went to a sink and rinsed off. The liquid was on the box.

item.description:
Report X-2024040410

  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found in QA area DescribePack: One of the gallons of adhesive dented at the top by the lid. Ring / cap around the top was loose. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Certified admin made sure that gloves and apron were on to handle the spill. The Hazmat was placed in a Clear Haz Mat bag and zip tied closed. before being moved to a yellow drum

item.title: Report X-2024040340
item.description:
Report X-2024040340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: STRAFFORD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was retrieved from delivery van by package handlers, and was being transported on a tugger cart. The packaged was noticed to be leaking. Upon discovery, QA was notified and contained the package. There was no apparent spillage on other packages or environment. DescribePack: The lid/closure was leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a hazmat tote.
